title_full:
the cure

              —
              Songs Of A Lost World
            
              (Polydor)
label: Polydor
description:
’SONGS OF A LOST WORLD’, the new album from The Cure, their 14th studio release and their first in 16 years.

"'SONGS OF A LOST WORLD' was written and arranged by Robert Smith, produced and mixed by Robert Smith & Paul Corkett and performed by The Cure - Robert Smith: Voice / guitar / 6string bass / keyboard, Simon Gallup: Bass, Jason Cooper: Drums / percussion, Roger O'Donnell: Keyboard, Reeves Gabrels: Guitar. The album was recorded at Rockfield Studios in Wales. Robert... more

label: Warp Records
description:
London-based "ambient jazz" ace Nala Sinephro steps up her game on 'Endlessness', playfully zig-zagging around an electrifying continuous arpeggio over ten cosmically interlinked tracks assembling decades of spiritual jazz echoing down the line. Fully transcendent material - essential listening for fans of Alice Coltrane, Jon Hassell, Sun Ra, Sons of Kemet, Dorothy Ashby, Laraaji.

It's Sinephro's boundless ambition that bubbles to the surface on 'Endlessness'. She was ever so subtly... more

artist: Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson
title_full:
Jeff Parker and ETA IVtet featuring Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson

              —
              The Way Out of Easy
            
              (International Anthem)
label: International Anthem
description:
Recorded at LA's recently shuttered ETA, 'The Way Out of Easy' is a celebration of iconic guitarist Jeff Parker's seven year residency alongside Anna Butterss, Jay Bellerose and Josh Johnson, touching on the weekly sessions' transcendent, groove-fwd hybridity with canny nods to post-rock, kosmische, hip-hop and dub.

For decades at this point, Parker has been restlessly innovating both as a soloist and a keen collaborator, working with formative post-rock outfits like Isotope 217... more

artist: Ariel Kalma, Jeremiah Chiu & Marta Sofia Honer
title_full:
Ariel Kalma, Jeremiah Chiu & Marta Sofia Honer

              —
              The Closest Thing to Silence
            
              (International Anthem)
label: International Anthem
description:
New age ambient spirit Ariel Kalma meets mutual souls Jeremiah Chiu & Marta Sofia Honer at the behest of BBC Radio 3’s Late Junction for a gently utopian and soothing first collaboration - RIYL FSOL’s Amorphous Androgynous, JD Emmanuel, CV & JAB, László Hortobágyi, Cluster

In answer to the long-running experimental radio show’s request to make music with artists he hadn’t worked with before, Kalma soon opted to jam with Chiu & Honer based on his appreciation of their... more

label: Matador
description:
With over four decades of relentless reinvention and innovation under her belt, Kim Gordon embraces failure on her mind-boggling latest solo LP, rapping and groaning over industrialized, hybrid trap beats that push so far into the red they almost disintegrate. Where a lesser presence could have let that production dominate, Gordon is always the total focus of our attention, the rhythm - as sick as it is - functions almost like a stock backing track, such is her shine. Essential gear.

We should have... more

title_full:
Etran de L'Aïr

              —
              100% Sahara Guitar
            
              (SAHEL SOUNDS)
label: SAHEL SOUNDS
description:
Glorious, knees-up ready demonstration of Niger’s Tuareg blues masters Etran de L’Aïr  - alum of the Music From Saharan WhatsApp - captured in full flight at a studio in Portland, OR.

As one may presume from the title, ‘100% Guitar’ is absolutely stacked with strings upon strings set to rattling kit drums and choral harmonies delivered with gusto. It finds the same line-up of the band a decade on from recordings that made up their cult debut ‘No. 1’ (issued in 2018) - Moussa “Abindi” Ibra (guitar... more
